thread.title: Tigerhawks sweep Keota, finish 2-2 at W-G tourney
thread.title_full: Tigerhawks sweep Keota, finish 2-2 at W-G tourney

title: Tigerhawks sweep Keota, finish 2-2 at W-G tourney
text:
Tigerhawks sweep Keota, finish 2-2 at W-G tourney Published: Monday, Oct. 19, 2015 11:36 a.m. CDT • Updated: Monday, Oct. 19, 2015 12:20 p.m. CDT Caption (Troy Hyde/Daily News) Colfax-Mingo sophomore Ries Wilson keeps the ball in play during a South Iowa Cedar League match earlier this season in Colfax. The Tigerhawks won at Keota on Thursday and then finished 2-2 in the Woodward-Granger tournament on Saturday. By Troy Hyde Newton Daily News 
KEOTA ­— Colfax-Mingo’s volleyball team gained some much-needed momentum this weekend as the postseason nears. 
The Tigerhawks concluded South Iowa Cedar League play with a convincing sweep of Keota on Thursday and then traveled to the Woodward-Granger tournament Saturday and finished with back-to-backs wins. 
Against Keota, sophomore Ries Wilson had 20 kills, 10 digs and four aces during Colfax-Mingo’s 25-10, 25-20, 25-22 win. Dakota Hostetter also had nine kills and two digs, while Megan Earles finished with 25 assists, 10 digs and was 10-for-10 in serves. 
Wilson was 10-of-11 in serves, and the Tigerhawks were 66-of-72 in all and served up 10 aces. 
The Tigerhawks (8-17 overall and 4-7 in SICL play) began the Woodward-Granger tournament on Saturday with straight-set losses to host Woodward-Granger and Class 1A No. 7 Grand View Christian. 
Against the Hawks, Wilson had three kills and 10 digs, but Woodward-Granger won 21-18, 21-6. Earles also had six assists, and Chelsea Russell collected seven digs. 
The Thunder handed Colfax-Mingo a 21-11, 21-17 loss. Wilson collected six kills and 10 digs, Hostetter chipped in three kills and six digs and Earles delivered nine assists. 
The Tigerhawks collected their first win of the tournament following a 23-21, 10-21, 15-7 win over Iowa Christian Academy. In that victory, Wilson had nine kills, 11 digs and two aces, while Earles dished out 16 assists. 
Hostetter finished with five kills and 10 digs, Russell collected 20 digs and was 11-for-11 in serves. Colfax-Mingo was 44-of-47 in serves with six aces. 
The final win of the weekend came against Panorama. Led by a double-double from Earles, the Tigerhawks won 21-12, 21-11. Earles had 14 assists, 13 digs and she was 7-for-7 in serves. 
Wilson had 10 kills, five digs and two aces, while Hostetter finished with seven digs and seven kills. Russell had 11 digs and two aces. The Tigerhawks were 40-of-41 in serves with seven aces.
